SENT.plain: Complete aortic thrombosis is rare in neonates
Because it carries high morbidity and mortality, this entity requires aggressive and early treatment

This report describes an 8-day-old healthy and exclusively breast-fed infant, without specific coagulopathy, who developed complete aortic and cerebral venous thrombosis, which was attributed to inadequate breast-feeding and severe hypernatremic dehydration
Early systemic anticoagulation and thrombolytic therapy allowed complete resolution of the problem
